                     Florida. With boundless energy and endless ideas, you motivate our community to achieve
                     more every day. Breadcrumb Navigation USF Home About USF Faculty & Staff As essential members of USF, your talent, tenacity, and commitment to excellence has
               helped drive our university to new heights. And with your vision, we are just getting
               started. We are proud you are part of the herd, and we wouldn’t be where we are today
               without your dedication, determination, and loyalty to our institution. Work at USF Faculty and staff are the lifeblood of an academic institution and central to the
                     performance trajectory of the University of South Florida. Apply to work at USF, where we advance communities and transform lives. For Faculty For Staff Benefits As a member of our diverse and talented workforce, you deserve an outstanding employee
                     experience. From essential benefits like health insurance and retirement plans to
                     optional programs for enrichment and work/life balance, the USF Division of Human
                     Resources has got you covered! Professional Development At USF, we provide endless opportunities for faculty and staff to learn, grow, and
                     achieve more. From technology training to furthering your research, we foster the
                     environment for you to challenge yourself and grow in your career. For Faculty For Staff Promotion & Tenure USF recognizes and rewards faculty and staff for their immeasurable contributions
                     to the university. We create an atmosphere that encourages you to develop and share different ideas and divergent
                     views and to make inquiries unbounded by present norms. For faculty, tenure contributes significantly to the creation of such an environment. Employee Success Center As a valued member of the USF community, we provide boundless resources for your success in Bulls Country. From a smooth onboarding process,
                     to learning, networking, and recognition opportunities, to wellness and performance
                     management, we make your transition to USF and beyond as enriching as possible. Perks & Discounts We know there’s nothing better than being a Bull, and local businesses feel the same!
                  Enjoy a range of discounts of goods, services and recreation, in the Tampa Bay area
                  and beyond, reserved for employees of USF.                Course: The type of Program The number of participants Two preferred dates Preferred time of the day for your Program (Morning/Afternoon) Challenge Course programs Pricing Table Price Per Person USF Affiliated Non-Profit For-Profit Lows (Half Day | 2-4h) $15 $20 $25 Lows (Full Day | 5-7h) $20 $25 $30 High Ropes (3-5h) $20 $25 $30 Lows + Highs (5-7h) $35 $45 $55 Zipline (2-4h) $15 $20 $25 How to make a reservation Making a reservation is simple, and easy! Fill out the Reservation Request Form This request must be submitted a minimum of one month prior to the requested date(s) Once received, you will be contacted with paperwork within 5 business days. Any questions, please email challengecourse@usf.edu Once a contract is signed, your course is officially reserved; you can change the
                  number of reserved participants up to two weeks before event date A Lead Facilitator assigned to your group will contact you within two weeks of your
                  reserved date to create your custom teambuilding curriculum Useful Resources Waivers | (In-Person) Adult Waivers Under 18 Waivers Waivers | (Portable) Adult Waivers Under 18 Waivers Participant Checklist Low Ropes Checklist High Ropes Checklist Directions to the Challenge Course The Challenge Course is less than 1.5 miles East of USF Tampa Campus, located at the
               USF Riverfront Park on Fletcher Ave and the Hillsborough River! The physical address
               is 6550 East Fletcher Ave, Tampa, FL 33617 . Heading East on Fletcher Avenue, take the next left turn after passing the 56th Street
                  intersection Heading West on Fletcher Avenue, take the next right after you passing Telecom Drive

Challenge Course Program Options | USF Campus Recreation Skip to Main Content University of South Florida Recreation & Wellness A Department of Student Success Search Search for: Main Navigation Menu Give Now Welcome About Recreation & Wellness About Us Accessibility Hours & Facilities Directions & Parking Lockers & Amenities Facility & Event Reservation Membership Policies Find Your Fit Summer Camps Outdoors & Aquatics About Outdoors & Aquatics Aquatics USF Riverfront Park USF Challenge Course Outdoor Resource Center Adventure Trips Trips & Special Events Registration Outdoor Recreation Special Events Pool Policies American Red Cross Courses SCUBA Certifications Aquatics Resources Fitness About Fitness Group Fitness Personal Training Fitness Programs Trainings & Certifications Fitness Services Your Group X Fitness Sports Programs About Intramural Sports Find Your Team Officials Find Your Sport Club Athletic Training Donate Esports Overview Our History Sponsorship & Opportunities Join The Stampede Esports Living Lab Testimonials Media Kit & Branding Connect Contact Us Our Team Work with RecWell Marketing & Media ONE USF Sponsorships MyUSF Directory Outdoors & Aquatics Skip Over Breadcrumbs and Secondary Navigation Breadcrumb Navigation Recreation & Wellness Outdoors & Aquatics USF Challenge Course Secondary Navigation About Outdoor Recreation Adventure Trips About Adventure Trips Adventure Trip FAQs Custom Adventure Trips Adventure Abroad Outdoor Training & Certifications Nature Rx Trips & Special Event Registration Aquatics About Aquatics American Red Cross Courses Private Swim Lessons SCUBA Certification Pool Policies Aquatics Resources Outdoor Resource Center USF Riverfront Park USF Challenge Course About Challenge Course Group Reservations Challenge Course Events Outdoor Recreation Events USF Riverfront Park First Year Adventure Trips USF Challenge Course The USF Challenge Course provides personal development and teambuilding programs in
               a safe, challenging, and supportive environment that promotes a deeper awareness of
               ourselves, others, and the natural world. Contact our Challenge Course Team with any questions or feedback ( challengecourse@usf.edu ). Work With Us Looking for a job with Recreation & Wellness, come join our team of challenge course
               facilitators. More information about information sessions and applications can be found here . Overview Group Reservations The USF Challenge Course uses a series of teambuilding games and activities to help
               groups develop leadership, problem solving, and communication skills. This course
               is a fantastic and engaging way to encourage team bonding, learning how to tackle
               challenges, and strengthening your team! The fifty-foot high course emphasizes healthy risk-taking and trust, with three levels
               filled with twenty unique challenges that enable participants to expand and grow out
               of their comfort zones. Once at the top, participants can choose to take the ultimate
               leap of faith on our zip line, soaring over the Riverfront Park! All group reservations include: One-on-one collaboration with a Lead Facilitator A customized teambuilding curriculum Full use of our Challenge Course tents, tables, and benches See our Group Reservation page to learn more! Challenge Course Events Want to experience the Challenge Course, but don’t have a group? Our Challenge Course Events
               are the perfect way for USF Students, Faculty, Staff, and the USF Community to enjoy
               the Challenge Course without a group reservation! Check out our Challenge Course Events page to learn more! Frequently Asked Questions How do I make a teambuilding reservation? Fill out the Reservation Request Form This request must be submitted a minimum of one month prior to the requested date(s) Once received, you will be contacted with paperwork within 5 business days. Any questions, please email challengecourse@usf.edu Once a contract is signed, your course is officially reserved; you can change the
                        number of reserved participants up to two weeks before event date A Lead Facilitator assigned to your group will contact you within two weeks of your
                        reserved date to create your custom teambuilding curriculum When can I expect to hear back from my reservation request? Please allow up to 5 business days for a response. We will get back to you as soon
                     as we are able to. What is the minimum for group size? Eight participants is the minimum for a group reservation. Do you have to be USF affiliated to make a reservation? No, we serve the USF population and its surrounding community. Prices vary based on
                     type of group. What is the timeframe/minimum time for a program? It is a minimum of 2 hours for a Lows Teambuilding program and a minimum of 3 hours
                     for a Highs Teambuilding program. What is the minimum age to go on the Challenge Course? We do not have an age minimum or limit for Lows Teambuilding. For our High Ropes Course, participants must be able to fit into a harness and helmet
                     without it falling below their hips or off their head to participate in High Teambuilding
                     on the Challenge Course. Do I need to know my billing information prior to submitting a reservation request? It is not required until you sign a contract. Will transportation be provided? Transportation is provided for all Challenge Course Events. Transportation is not
                     provided for all Teambuilding Reservations. What are your COVID-19 policies? We will be following COVID-19 precautions during your event. The below precautions
                     are recommended: Usage of hand sanitizer before and after touching any props/teambuilding materials Having group members bring their own food and water How do I become a part of the Challenge Course team? We hire twice a year. Once in early October and again in late Feb/early March. If
                     you are interested in joining our team, please email your resume and a cover letter
                     to Shea Van Alstyne, Challenge Course Coordinator, at ssvanalstyne@usf.edu . What is the cost to reserve the Challenge Course? You can find our pricing information on the Group Reservations page.                to kayaks and canoeing, to pavilions, the USF Riverfront Park is a lovely place to
               spend the afternoon!                and general conduct can be found on this page. For any questions, comments, or concerns, reach out to us via email at campusrec@usf.edu . General Facility Policies General Recreation & Wellness Policies Last Updated: May 5, 2023 All Recreation & Wellness users must present a current, valid USF ID Card. Using false identification is a violation of the USF Student Code of Conduct , individuals who present false identification or whose ID is presented by another
                        person may forfeit Recreation & Wellness privileges. Fraudulent IDs will be confiscated and destroyed; the owner will have to obtain a
                              new ID through the card center. Entrance to Recreation & Wellness facilities is only allowed through the access control
                        area of the Welcome Desk. Anyone found to have entered the facilities through any
                        other means will be asked to leave the premises and further disciplinary action may
                        be taken. Recreation & Wellness reserves the right to refuse admittance to anyone. All policies outlined in the University of South Florida Student Code of Conduct will be enforced. All Recreation & Wellness users are expected to be responsible, courteous, and safety
                        conscious at all times. Behavior such as criminal activity, disorderly conduct, sexual
                        harassment, recklessness, abuse or misuse of the facility and its equipment, or disregard
                        for Recreation & Wellness policies and staff will not be tolerated. Violators will
                        be required to leave the facility and may be subject to disciplinary action up to
                        and including temporary or permanent revocation of Recreation & Wellness access. Fee-paying
                        members who have their access revoked will not have any portion of their fees refunded. Recreation & Wellness is not responsible for lost or stolen items. Use of personal bicycles, skateboards, roller skates, powered transportation (includes,
                        but is not limited to, hover boards, skateboards, scooters, Segways, etc.), or roller
                        blades is prohibited inside all Recreation & Wellness facilities. Personal bicycles
                        are not permitted to be stored anywhere within Recreation & Wellness facilities (with
                        the exception of Outdoor Recreation Bike Shop). Due to their serious potential fire hazard, the operation, charging, or storage of
                                 transportation related devices with Lithium-Ion batteries/battery packs are prohibited
                                 inside any Recreation & Wellness facilities on USF's Campus. This includes, but is
                                 not limited to, hover boards, skateboards, scooters, Segways, etc. Pets are not permitted inside the facilities, except approved service animals. According to USF Policy 6-033 (Animals on Campus) Section III, Subsection H , a service animals "[a]s defined by the Americans with Disabilities Act Amendment
                              Act (ADAAA), Service Animals are dogs or miniature horses that are individually trained
                              to do work or perform tasks for people with disabilities. Examples of such work or
                              tasks include guiding people who are blind, alerting people who are deaf, pulling
                              a wheelchair, alerting and protecting a person who is having a seizure, reminding
                              a person with mental illness to take prescribed medications, calming a person with
                              Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) during an anxiety attack, or performing  other
                              duties. Service Animals are working animals, not pets. The work or task an animal
                              has been trained to provide must be directly related to the person’s disability and
                              must always be with and under the control of the Eligible Person. The Service Animal
                              may not be left unattended. Animals whose sole function is to provide comfort or emotional
                              support do not qualify as service animals under the ADAAA." In addition, USF Policy 6-033 (Animals on Campus) Section V, Subsection K , "[a]ll animals including any of the animals falling in the Exceptions section of
                              this Policy must not be unruly or disruptive, be in ill health or unclean. An animal
                              may be removed from USF property if the animal is a direct threat to the health and
                              safety of others, or if the animal is disruptive or out of control. USF may temporarily
                              or permanently exclude any animal including any of those listed as Exceptions at the
                              discretion of the facilities manager, EH&S or emergency personnel." Emotional support animals, defined as "[a]n animal whose sole function is to provide
                              emotional support", are not permitted per USF Policy 6-033 (Animals on Campus) Section III, Subsection D . Outdoor Fields Info & Policies Last Update: June 27, 2025 LOCATIONS The policies below apply to the following outdoor facilities, located on the USF Tampa
                     Campus: Fowler Fields Magnolia Fields Research Park Fields AVAILABILITY Open recreation on the fields operates on a shared play . All event reservation requests must go through the Recreation & Wellness Special Events
                     Team. Click here for more info - Facility & Event Reservations . POLICIES All Recreation & Wellness General Policies outlined in the Conduct Standards & Policies
                        will be enforced. All users must present a current , valid USF ID card to use outdoor facilities if requested by Recreation & Wellness Staff
                        Member or University Police Department. Non-university groups/individuals must have an Event Permit from the Recreation & Wellness Department. USF groups of 15+ people are not allowed , and they must make a field reservation through USF Recreation & Wellness Special Events . Pets are not permitted at any outdoor facility; except approved service animals. According to USF Policy 6-033 (Animals on Campus) Section III, Subsection H , a service animals "[a]s defined by the Americans with Disabilities Act Amendment
                              Act (ADAAA), Service Animals are dogs or miniature horses that are individually trained
                              to do work or perform tasks for people with disabilities. Examples of such work or
                              tasks include guiding people who are blind, alerting people who are deaf, pulling
                              a wheelchair, alerting and protecting a person who is having a seizure, reminding
                              a person with mental illness to take prescribed medications, calming a person with
                              Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) during an anxiety attack, or performing  other
                              duties. Service Animals are working animals, not pets. The work or task an animal
                              has been trained to provide must be directly related to the person’s disability and
                              must always be with and under the control of the Eligible Person. The Service Animal
                              may not be left unattended. Animals whose sole function is to provide comfort or emotional
                              support do not qualify as service animals under the ADAAA." In addition, USF Policy 6-033 (Animals on Campus) Section V, Subsection K , "[a]ll animals including any of the animals falling in the Exceptions section of
                              this Policy must not be unruly or disruptive, be in ill health or unclean. An animal
                              may be removed from USF property if the animal is a direct threat to the health and
                              safety of others, or if the animal is disruptive or out of control. USF may temporarily
                              or permanently exclude any animal including any of those listed as Exceptions at the
                              discretion of the facilities manager, EH&S or emergency personnel." Emotional support animals, defined as "[a]n animal whose sole function is to provide
                              emotional support", are not permitted per USF Policy 6-033 (Animals on Campus) Section III, Subsection D . Any permitted animals must be on a leash, per USF Policy 6-033 (Animals on Campus) Section IV, Subsection A , where "[i]n parts of the campuses where animals may be permitted, such animals must
                              be kept securely controlled by a harness or leash not to exceed ten (10) feet in length
                              (unless there is an exception granted based on disability)." Closed toe shoes are required to participate in physical activity at any outdoor facility. Glass bottles are not permitted at any outdoor facility. All chained equipment is used for programmed Recreation & Wellness activities only. Any tampering with this equipment will be considered vandalism. Field lights are at the discretion of the Recreation & Wellness Staff and may be turned
                        off in periods of field maintenance. Use of metal cleats is not permitted . POLICIES The USF Esports Living Lab is open to all currently enrolled USF students and USF faculty/staff with a valid USF ID during scheduled open hours. Users of the Esports Lab must always comply with all staff directives and all other
                           departmental, university, state, and federal policies, including the technology use
                           policies of USF (no installation of program on computers, etc.). The Lab PCs are to be used for approved gaming purposes only, all other uses prohibited. All lab equipment, including hardware, peripherals, furniture, etc. is not to be removed
                           from the lab for any reason. No food or beverages are allowed into the Esports Lab except for water. Water must
                           be in a sealed, leak-proof container. Consumption of alcohol or other substances is
                           strictly prohibited. Bags and personal belongings must always be stored under the desk or at a staff designated
                        location and out of the way. Personal gear (including but not limited to) peripherals, backpacks, etc. must not
                        show discriminatory or profane decals. Demonstrate respect for equipment and personnel – no toxicity allowed. All participants must adhere to both USF Student Code of Conduct and Recreation & Wellness Codes of Conducts, including but not limited to the following
                        directive: Treat Sports Programs and Recreation & Wellness Staff with respect. Act with character and courtesy while respecting the rights, welfare and dignity of
                              all others in the Esports facility. Refrain from vulgar language and offensive conduct. Act in a safe, responsible manner regarding equipment, self, and others. Contact a member of the Sports Programs Staff should an accident, injury, or related
                              incident occur. During emergency situations, follow the direction of USF Recreation & Wellness Staff. Gaming sessions will be capped to the amount of time reserved. Failure to adhere to
                        these time limits may result in disciplinary action. Users will be limited to two (2) sessions per day - Four (4) hours max . No new games should be started that may exceed the amount of time reserved or the
                        closing of the lab - Thirty (30) minutes recommended . Be sure to log out of all game accounts before leaving your station. DISCIPLINE POLICY USF Esports and Recreation & Wellness will use a three-strike discipline system for
                     the Esports Living Lab. The details of the system follow as below: Strike One: Verbal Warning by Sports Programs Staff and Email Confirmation of 1 st Strike. Strike Two: Verbal Warning by Sports Programs Staff, Email Confirmation of 2 nd Strike, and loss of lab access for 1 week . Strike Three: Immediate removal from Lab, Email Confirmation of 3 rd Strike, and loss of Lab privileges for the remainder of the academic year . Strikes can be given by Sports Programs Staff for any of the following: Disruptive behavior as described in the USF Esports Lab Policies. Playing over your allotted reservation time. Defying any of the USF Esports Lab Policies. Not following instructions of the USF Sports Programs Staff. Any other action deemed punishable by USF Sports Programs Staff. USF Sports Programs reserves the right to bypass these policies if deemed necessary
                     by USF Recreation & Wellness Professional Staff. Athletic Training (AT) Clinic Info & Policies Last Update: June 27, 2025 The Athletic Training Clinic is closed until further notice. LOCATION These policies cover the USF Recreation & Wellness Athletic Training Clinic, which
                     is located in the main USF Recreation & Wellness facility (Campus Recreation Center)
                     on the Tampa Campus. POLICIES The AT Clinic is committed to providing all patients with the best possible care. All Rules and Policies from the USF Student Code of Conduct applies in the AT Clinic; please treat everyone in a respectful manner. All Recreation & Wellness Facilities Policies must be followed. Attire must be compliant with Recreation & Wellness Facilities Policies Only certified Athletic Training Staff is allowed to perform treatments such as, but
                        not limited to, electrical stimulation. Permission must be granted before using any equipment, and must be used within the
                        appropriate spaces while in use. No rude behavior, hazing, and/or any hate language will be tolerated. No food or drinks allowed; water is permitted. No shoes on any tables/benches in the AT Clinic. Usage of phones is allowed, however no photography is permitted inside/into the AT
                        Clinic as to provide privacy for our patients. Outdoor Recreation Policies Riverfront Park Info & Policies Last Update: May 5, 2023 LOCATION & INFORMATION The USF Riverfront Park is located directly off Fletcher Avenue. Riverfront Park is home to the USF Challenge Course , the Boathouse, an 18-hole disc golf course, and pavilions for rental. All event reservation requests must go through the Recreation & Wellness Special Events
                     Team. Click here for more info - Facility & Event Reservations . POLICIES All Recreation & Wellness General Policies outlined in the Conduct Standards & Policies
                        will be enforced. The Riverfront Park is for use by USF Students, Staff, Faculty, and reservation only. Campfires are permitted in designated campfire circles only. If there is a fire ban in place for Hillsborough County, fires are not permitted . Riverfront Park closing times are listed on our website and on-location at the park. Visitors must exit the park prior to closing. Failure to do so constitutes trespassing, and vehicles remaining after park close
                              are subject to tow at the owner’s expense. No alcoholic beverages or illegal drugs are permitted at Riverfront Park at any time. No glass bottles may be used at Riverfront Park. Organized groups of 10+ are not allowed as they must make a pavilion reservation. Your group is responsible for cleaning up the pavilion area after use; please place
                        recyclable material and trash in the proper receptacles. Upon arrival and departure, please check in and out at the USF Boathouse; before leaving,
                        a staff member will review the Pavilion area. For reservations occurring while the USF Boathouse is closed, keep a copy of the reservation
                              confirmation email at the pavilion with the group at all times. Dogs must be leashed at all times; owners are required to clean up after their dog
                        and place waste in the proper receptacle. No vehicles will be allowed to drive or park by the Pavilions. Groups with catering concerns may make prior arrangements with the Recreation & Wellness Special Events Team . Water balloons, silly string, confetti (et al.) are strictly prohibited. Challenge Course activities, Pavilion reservations, and Recreation & Wellness Special
                        Events take precedence over open recreation, including disc golf, and may impact the
                        available activities for open recreation. Challenge Course activities may not be used without Challenge Course Staff supervision. Boat rental is available on a first-come, first-served basis. Large groups can make arrangements in advance to be billed for boat rentals after
                              their event. Adventure Trip Info & Policies Last Update: May 5, 2023 LOCATION & INFORMATION The Adventure Trips office can be located in the Outdoor Resource Center , found in the main Campus Recreation Center (REC), downstairs next to the Men's Locker
                     Room. USF Recreation & Wellness’ Adventure Trip Program provides opportunities for you to
                     get outdoors and connect with the natural world on various adventures! POLICIES We want for our trips to be safe , fun , and memorable . Due to weather and other safety concerns, trip itineraries are subject to change. Trip Leaders will communicate any changes in a timely manner. Outdoor Recreation practices strong Leave No Trace ethics. Pack it in, pack it out! All students participating in Recreation & Wellness Programs are expected to follow
                        the University of South Florida Student Code of Conduct. Should violations of said Code occur, participants risk expulsion from the trip and
                              barring from participation in future programs. Outdoor Recreation does not condone disrespectful use of language and/or violence
                        towards participants on any of our trips. Use of such language or actions could result
                        in expulsion from the program.  We strive to create a community space where meaningful
                        dialogues and personal growth can take place. Adventure Trips are Alcohol Alternative Programs, therefore no alcohol is allowed
                        to be consumed during the trip. Any underage consumption could result in University
                        judicial consequences. No illicit drugs or drug paraphernalia are allowed on trips in any fashion. Breach of this rule will result in an immediate expulsion from the trip and could
                              result in University judicial consequences. We reserve the right to cancel a program due to inclement weather, natural disasters,
                        or extenuating circumstances. In the event we must cancel a program, a full trip refund will be provided. You can find the full refund policy on the Trip Registration page. Aquatics Policies REC Pool Info & Policies Last Update: May 5, 2023 LOCATION & INFORMATION The REC Pool is located in the main Campus Recreation Gym (REC) on the USF Tampa Campus. For questions concerning reservations, please contact rec-reservations@usf.edu . POLICIES Usage of the pool is not permitted without a Recreation & Wellness Lifeguard on stand. Lifeguards reserve the right to remove patrons from the pool for unsafe and unruly
                        behavior. Lifeguards reserve the right to restrict the use of the deep-water area to patrons
                        according to swimming ability. Patrons must shower before entering the pool. Patrons must wear appropriate swim attire while using the pool. All diaper-aged patrons must wear a swim diaper at all times in the pool area. Patrons are required to utilize the locker rooms while changing into or out of swim
                        attire; changing clothes is not permitted in the pool area. Patrons under the age of 16 and patrons wearing flotation devices must be accompanied
                        by a parent or guardian. Glass containers, alcoholic beverages, food, drinks, and gum are not permitted in
                        the pool area. Running, wrestling, and horseplay are not permitted in the pool area. Bicycles, skateboards, scooters, and roller skates are not permitted in the pool area. Animals (excluding service animals that are registered with Student Accessibility Services ) are not permitted in the pool area or locker rooms. Smoking is not permitted in the pool area. Diving is not permitted in the pool area. Pool hours are subject to change and are located on the USF Recreation & Wellness website . Pool equipment rented through Facilities or Aquatics is to be used properly. Improper usage of pool equipment will result in dismissal from the pool area. *Pool area includes the pool and pool deck. FIT Pool Info & Policies Last Update: May 5, 2023 LOCATION & INFORMATION The FIT Pool is located at the satellite FIT Facility within The Village on the North side of the USF Tampa Campus. For questions concerning reservations, please contact rec-reservations@usf.edu . POLICIES Pool hours are subject to change without notice due to inclement weather. Pool will shut down when lightning is within 10 miles. Pool deck will close when lightning is within 4 miles. Usage of the pool is not permitted without a Recreation & Wellness Lifeguard on stand. Lifeguards reserve the right to remove patrons from the pool for unsafe and unruly
                        behavior. Patrons must shower before entering the pool. Patrons must wear appropriate swim attire while using the pool. All diaper aged patrons must wear a swim diaper at all times in the pool area. Patrons are required to utilize the locker rooms while changing into or out of swim
                        attire; changing clothes is not permitted in the pool area. Patrons under the age of 16 and patrons wearing flotation devices must be accompanied
                        by a parent or guardian. Glass containers, alcoholic beverages, food, drinks, and gum are not permitted in
                        the pool area. Running, wrestling, and horseplay are not permitted in the pool area. Bicycles, skateboards, scooters, and roller skates are not permitted in the pool area. Animals (excluding service animals that are registered with Student Accessibility Services ) are not permitted in the pool area or locker rooms. Smoking is not permitted in the pool area. Diving is not permitted in the pool area. Pool hours are subject to change and are located on the USF Recreation & Wellness website . Pool equipment rented through Facilities or Aquatics is to be used properly. Improper usage of pool equipment will result in dismissal from the pool area. *Pool area includes the pool and pool deck. We accept Visa or Mastercard
               only. You must have your USF ID or Alumni USF ID card in order to rent a boat. Stand Up paddle are now available to rent for $5 per board for up to 2 hours. Renters must follow the regular boating rules and wear
               a life jacket. Boards cannot be reserved and are available on a first come, first
               served basis. Boat Rental Options Two & Three Person Canoes Single Person Kayaks Two Person Kayaks Stand Up Paddleboard Single Boat Rental Single daily boat rental for canoes and 2 person kayaks is $10.00 per boat for up
               to 2 hours. Single daily boat rental for 1 person kayaks and stand up paddle boards
               is $5.00 per boat for up to 2 hours. Each single daily boat rental is valid for one
               canoe, kayak (single or double), or stand up paddle board. One person with a valid
               USF ID or Alumni ID card will be able to rent up to 2 boats for the rental period.
               No refunds are issued for unused hours in the rental period. Full Usage Pass Sold for all the boating services at the park for an entire semester except Moonlight
               Canoeing. A full usage pass entitles the holder to take a canoe for up to two hours
               during the week or the weekend. Cost of the semester full usage pass is $45.00 . Full usage holders may receive special coupons and discounts on Outdoor Rec Items. Moonlight Canoeing Join us on the Hillsborough River at dusk or in the dark for Moonlight Canoeing. Boats
               will launch from the USF Riverfront Park Boathouse at 6550 E Fletcher Ave Tampa, FL
               33647 (Fletcher Ave and the Hillsborough River). Bring your ID to the boathouse to
               check in. Register for Moonlight Canoeing here! Current USF ID or valid Alumni Association membership card required for ALL rentals
                  and entrance into Riverfront Park. No Exceptions! Unwind at the end of the day with a guided sunset paddle from the University’s boathouse along the scenic Hillsborough River. As the sun dips below the horizon, we’ll glide through calm waters surrounded by cypress trees, Spanish moss, and the sounds of nature winding down for the night. This relaxing trip is perfect for all experience levels and offers a front-row seat to one of Florida’s most beautiful golden hours. Whether you're looking to de-stress, connect with nature, or just enjoy a peaceful evening on the water, this paddle is the perfect midweek escape. Total Trip Price: $10 Fall 2025 Program Time: September 9th (7PM) October 7th (6:30PM) November 4th (5:30PM) December 2nd (5PM) (Must arrive at the USF Riverfront Park Boathouse by the time listed above.) Included in Price: Staff guides, kayaking equipment (kayak, paddle, PFD, dry bag) Plan to wear clothes that can potentially get wet, bring a water bottle to stay hydrated! Not Included in Price: Transportation to USF Riverfront Park provided by request only All cancellation must be requested 24 hours in advance, otherwise no refund will be issued. Please contact adventure@usf.edu to request a refund. Trip times listed below and itineraries are subject to change based on weather, unforeseen circumstances, and risk management/logistical decisions from the Adventure Trip Program Staff. Full refunds will be issued in the event of the trip’s cancellation or if requested after being informed by the trip leader of a major change to the trip itinerary (i.e. trip location change, variation from activities advertised). All refund requests can be submitted to smkoster@usf.edu. USF is an Equal Opportunity/Equal Access Institution. For disability accommodations, contact Steven Koster (813-974-6381, smkoster@usf.edu).
